author: sky.cactus
content: It is certainly easy to make it so anyone can run some code on a small device.  The hard part is doing it in a way that maintains Ethereum's censorship resistance, permissionless, and trustless properties.  Doing *that* on a small device is what is hard.

author: sky.cactus
content: There are people who have thought a lot about this and solutions to the problems are in the works (like Portal Network, verkle trees, stateless, and zkproofs).  However, all of these are large undertakings that will, optimistically, take many years to build, test, deploy.

author: sky.cactus
content: So yes, it is a solvable problem, in theory.  In practice with an existing chain it is a very hard problem.
